ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A fantastic course that provides structure and guidance to developing and writing your senior thesis
Obviously required for senior EVST majors - but don't see it as an obligation. A good way to get to know everyone and the Professors.

Not that you really get to take this course as an option but yeah the colloquium is REALLY useful. Writing a thesis sucks but you don't really get an option. The constant deadlines though annoying are very helpful if you're an unmotivated senior with a problem with procrastination. The classes don't just go over writing a paper which is nice though. We also go over career stuff. ALSO ALWAYS ATTEND THE DINNER PARTIES. For one, the professors will give you a hard time for not going, Also free food!
You have to take it as an EVST major. It's a bunch of fun. Brings the group together. That being said- organize and really hold yourself accountable to your timeline.

I actually do like that the EVST majors requires a colloquium (but again it should only be fall semester). it allowed to get to know my classmates better,and i appreciate the life and career advice sprinkled throughout.
